definition.text: Mean Reversion Channels use the concept that everything has a tendency to revert back to its average value. The channels attempt to identify overbought and oversold areas in which the price action is likely to provide some resistance.

paragraphs.text: Mean Reversion Channels on the Charts

The indicator calculates the average price using a "Super Smoother" function, before applying offsets above and below the average. The offsets provide a weak overbought/oversold zone, and a standard overbought/oversold zone. Price action outside these zones provide a strong overbought and oversold area.
The following properties are available to access:

| Product Name | Product Variable | Properties |
| MeanReversionChannels | mrc | meanLine, res1, res2, sup1, sup2, UpHigh, UpLow, DnHigh, DnLow, condition, distance, width |
The "condition" value indicates the potential strength of a rebound, with +/-1 being the strongest and +/-5 as the weakest. A positive value indicates a downward reversal and vice versa.
The "distance" value is the % distance from the mean that the candle close is from the mean.
The "width" value is the %width of the upper and lower channels in relation to the price action.

The parameters of the indicator's calculations can be changed by locating and opening the Javascript Code under Data Building Procedure -> Procedure Loop under "Mean Reversion Channels" Procedure Loop.
